paper_metadata.title: China's fourth round of the poverty alleviation program evaluation

program_information.program_name: China's fourth round poverty alleviation program

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: our difference-in-differences and difference-in-discontinuities estimates suggest that the program increased GDP per capita in the 14 areas by over 45% from 2012 to 2019 | we find that the program significantly elevated rural income and reduced rural poverty
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: our difference-in-differences and difference-in-discontinuities estimates suggest

bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: From 2012 to 2019, China allocated a total of 813.6 billion yuan (US$126.1 billion), primarily to economic development programs within these 14 areas

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This study evaluates the impact of China's fourth round of the poverty alleviation program
evidence_citations.country_citation: This study evaluates the impact of China's fourth round of the poverty alleviation program, which targeted 14 contiguous destitute areas containing 680 counties and a population of 240 million
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: This study evaluates the impact of China's fourth round of the poverty alleviation program, which targeted 14 contiguous destitute areas containing 680 counties and a population of 240 million
